response:
I would use the **read_file** tool to accomplish this task.

**Arguments I would pass:**
- path: "/etc/config.yaml"

**Why this is appropriate:**
The read_file tool is specifically designed to read and return the contents of files. Since you want to view the configuration file at /etc/config.yaml, this tool will open that file and display its contents so you can see what configuration settings are stored there. This is the most direct and appropriate tool for reading an existing file without making any modifications to it.
